channel.title: CVE Feed for Kaspersky Lab -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Kaspersky Lab -- all products

item.title: CVE-2019-8280|2024-09-17T01:40:44.392Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- ultravnc
item.description: UltraVNC revision 1203 has out-of-bounds access vulnerability in VNC client inside RAW decoder, which can potentially result code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. This vulnerability has been fixed in revision 1204.

item.title: CVE-2018-15125|2024-09-17T03:38:11.520Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- zipato%20zipabox%20smart%20home%20controller
item.description: Sensitive Information Disclosure in Zipato Zipabox Smart Home Controller allows remote attacker get sensitive information that expands attack surface.

item.title: CVE-2019-8269|2024-09-17T00:30:43.266Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- ultravnc
item.description: UltraVNC revision 1206 has stack-based Buffer overflow vulnerability in VNC client code inside FileTransfer module, which leads to a denial of service (DoS) condition. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. This vulnerability has been fixed in revision 1207.

item.title: CVE-2019-8275|2024-09-17T03:12:37.776Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- ultravnc
item.description: UltraVNC revision 1211 has multiple improper null termination vulnerabilities in VNC server code, which result in out-of-bound data being accessed by remote users. This attack appears to be exploitable via network connectivity. These vulnerabilities have been fixed in revision 1212.

item.title: CVE-2018-6306|2024-09-17T01:30:42.840Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- kaspersky%20password%20manager
item.description: Unauthorized code execution from specific DLL and is known as DLL Hijacking attack in Kaspersky Password Manager versions before 8.0.6.538.

item.title: CVE-2019-8268|2024-09-17T01:16:16.319Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- ultravnc
item.description: UltraVNC revision 1206 has multiple off-by-one vulnerabilities in VNC client code connected with improper usage of ClientConnection::ReadString function, which can potentially result code execution. This attack appears to be exploitable via network connectivity. These vulnerabilities have been fixed in revision 1207.

item.title: CVE-2019-8279|2024-09-17T00:21:56.165Z -- kaspersky%20lab -- vanilla%20forums
item.description: Multiple stored XSS in Vanilla Forums before 2.5 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into any message on forum.
